projects.title: Connecting the Dots
projects.description: This project is a test demo build of a minigame where you place clues, represented by cards, onto a board and attach them to each other with a rope. Every clue is either related or contradicts eachother and it is the player's job to connect everything together with the ropes and solve the mystery! If 2 clues are related to eachother (ex. an apple and an orange are both fruits), the rope connecting them will turn green. If they contradict eachother (ex. an apple is a fruit and a carrot is a vegetable), the rope will turn red. However, if they have nothing to do with eachother (ex. an apple and a car), the rope will disappear and the player will lose health.

projects.title: The Hungry Pufferfish
projects.description:
This game was made in the Unity Engine in less then 24 hours for the 2024 UdeM Game Jam. You play as a pufferfish tumbling down a series of hills, eating shrimps along the way to grow bigger in size. The heavier you are, the more chances you have to pass the various gates in your way. 
By using Unity's 2D physics engine, this game is meant to better understand the concept and application of momentum for University of Montreal's students.
